alert.note: Alert for Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 10:21PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wisconsin, including the following county, Wood. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1017 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. A mesonet site in Nekoosa reported 2.16 inches since 9 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wisconsin Rapids, Pittsville, Babcock, Lake Wazeecha, Nekoosa, Port Edwards, Biron, Vesper, Rudolph, Cranmoor, Walker, Dexterville, Sandhill Wildlife Area, Veedum and Scranton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
